results.title: Buckeye Traffic - Camera Site Data
results.name: buckeyetraffic_camera_site_data
results.description: The Camera Site data is accessed from http://www.buckeyetraffic.org/services/Cameras.aspx. Each Camera Site contains a textual location attribute, a latitude and longitude value and a collection of Camera Feeds.

results.title: CoGo GBFS Station Information
results.name: cogo_gbfs_station_information
results.description:
This dataset presents information about CoGo bike stations including their name, location, capacity, etc.

This dataset is saved in a nested structure, see below for an example query.

Example Query

This query joins this dataset with another that describes COGO stations. It will get only the latest status and information of COGO stations.

SELECT * FROM
  (SELECT station_id,
          num_bikes_available,
          num_bikes_disabled,
          num_docks_available,
          num_docks_disabled,
          is_installed,
          is_renting,
          is_returning
   FROM
        (SELECT data.stations AS stations
         FROM cogo__cogo_gbfs_station_status
         ORDER BY last_updated DESC
         LIMIT 1)
      CROSS JOIN UNNEST(stations))
JOIN
  (SELECT station_id,
          name,
          lat,
          lon,
          address,
          capacity
   FROM
     (SELECT data.stations AS stations
      FROM cogo__cogo_gbfs_station_information
      ORDER BY last_updated DESC
      LIMIT 1)
   CROSS JOIN UNNEST(stations)) USING (station_id)

results.title: CoGo GBFS Station Status
results.name: cogo_gbfs_station_status
results.description:
This dataset presents information about statuses of each CoGo bike station identified in the COGO GBFS Station Infomation dataset. Information provided in this dataset includes bikes available, docks available, docks disables, station status of installed, renting and returning, etc.

This dataset is saved in a nested structure, see below for an example query.

Example Query

This query joins this dataset with another that describes COGO stations. It will get only the latest status and information of COGO stations.

SELECT * FROM
  (SELECT station_id,
          num_bikes_available,
          num_bikes_disabled,
          num_docks_available,
          num_docks_disabled,
          is_installed,
          is_renting,
          is_returning
   FROM
        (SELECT data.stations AS stations
         FROM cogo__cogo_gbfs_station_status
         ORDER BY last_updated DESC
         LIMIT 1)
      CROSS JOIN UNNEST(stations))
JOIN
  (SELECT station_id,
          name,
          lat,
          lon,
          address,
          capacity
   FROM
     (SELECT data.stations AS stations
      FROM cogo__cogo_gbfs_station_information
      ORDER BY last_updated DESC
      LIMIT 1)
   CROSS JOIN UNNEST(stations)) USING (station_id)
